feature.name: Divine Domain: Baking Domain
feature.text:
Gods of baking are those who put their faith into flour, yeast, and water, roll it up, stick it in an oven, and share its warm rewards with the rest of the world. Whether it's bread, cakes, rolls, cookies, or even donuts, clerics who follow the tenets of the baking domain sow their magic into food, using it to assist companions and others in need. In Wandrossa, the gods who offer baking as domain include the Jade Panda, Avelynn, and even Coram Krulak. In fact, there is a new divine bakery in Port Mathis that offers enchanted cookies for weary patrons.
Baking Domain Spells: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared:
1st — goodberry, purify food and drink 3rd — calm emotions, heat metal 5th — create food and water, aura of vitality 7th — aura of purity, wall of fire 9th — mass cure wounds, greater restoration
Source: DMDave, Baking Divine Domain (Mar 2019)

feature.name: Bonus Proficiencies (Baking Domain)
feature.text:
When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain proficiency with cook’s utencils.
Source: DMDave, Baking Divine Domain

feature.name: Baked Goods (Baking Domain)
feature.text:
At 1st level, whenever you cast goodberry, you can choose to have four biscuits, cookies, donuts, or other baked goods appear in your hand instead of berries. Eating the baked goods restores 3 hit points instead of the 1 normally provided by goodberry. When you reach 5th level in this class, the amount of healing your baked good provides increases by 2 hit points at 5th level (5), 11th level (7), and 17th level (9).
Source: DMDave, Baking Divine Domain

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Good Smells (Baking Domain)
feature.text:
Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest through baking. If you or any friendly creatures who can smell your baked goods regain hit points at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures gains extra hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.
Source: DMDave, Baking Divine Domain

feature.name: Good Natured Cook (Baking Domain)
feature.text:
Starting at 6th level, your pleasant demeanor and attitude grant you special abilities: • You are immune to being frightened. • When taking damage, you have advantage on Consitution saving throws to maintain your concentration on spells. • You can cast create food and water without expending a spell slot and the food you create is always delicious. Once you cast create food and water in this way, you can’t do so again until you complete a long rest.
Source: DMDave, Baking Divine Domain

feature.name: Potent Spellcasting (Baking Domain)
feature.text:
Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.
Source: DMDave, Baking Divine Domain

feature.name: Saint of the Oven (Baking Domain)
feature.text:
At 17th level, your skill in the kitchen is rarely contested. Instead of the healing effects offered by the food you create with your Baked Goods feature, you can choose to imbue the baked goods with the effects of one of the following spells instead: enhance ability (choose the ability type when you bake the goods), lesser restoration, protection from energy (choose the damage type when you bake the goods). All four baked goods must have the same effect. After a creature eats the baked good, the spell takes effect as if you had cast it upon it.
Source: DMDave, Baking Divine Domain

feature.name: Divine Domain: Space Domain
feature.text:
GThe multiverse is an endless infinity of worlds, planes, dimensions, and everything in between. As such, the gods have learned that magical means of travel are much more effective and efficient than traditional, physical means. Therefore, having control over space is a necessity for nearly all divine beings. Space domain clerics are awarded the instantaneous travel and communication powers of their deities. Capable of traversing great distances, space domain clerics are master tacticians as well as an invaluable asset to those they adventure with.
Space Domain Spells: At each indicated cleric level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared:
1st — expeditious retreat, jump 3rd — levitate, misty step 5th — haste, sending 7th — banishment, dimension door 9th — contact other plane, teleportation circle
Source: DMDave, EVIL p.11 (Jan 2019)

feature.name: Bonus Cantrip (Space Domain)
feature.text:
When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the message cantrip if you don’t already know it and you may cast it as a bonus action on each of your turns.
Source: DMDave, EVIL p.11

feature.name: Incidental Teleportation (Space Domain)
feature.text:
At 1st level, when you select this Domain, you can use your action to target an inanimate object not being worn or held by another creature that you can see within 120 feet of you. This object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object. The object disappears from its present location and reappears into your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Source: DMDave, EVIL p.11

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Accelerate (Space Domain)
feature.text:
At 2nd level, you can call upon your god’s power to increase the movement speed others around you. As an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to choose a number of creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one). Each creature can use its bonus action to take the Dash action until the end of its next turn.
Source: DMDave, EVIL p.11

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Zone Shift (Space Domain)
feature.text:
Starting at 6th level, when a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you ends its turn, you can use your reaction to teleport the creature 30 feet from its starting position to an unoccupied space you can see, using your Channel Divinity. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Charisma saving throw versus your spell save DC is unaffected.
Source: DMDave, EVIL p.11

feature.name: Potent Spellcasting (Space Domain)
feature.text:
Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.
Source: DMDave, EVIL p.11

feature.name: Portal Priest (Space Domain)
feature.text:
At 17th level, your mastery of dimensional travel becomes exceptional. You gain the following benefits: • When you cast the haste spell on yourself, you gain a +4 bonus to your AC instead of the +2 normally offered by the spell. In addition, when the spell ends, you can move and take actions as normal. • Immediately after you teleport using the misty step spell, you can enable one creature within 60 feet of you to use its reaction to gain the benefits of the misty step spell. • When you cast the dimension door spell, the spell’s range increases to 1000 feet and you can bring with you a number of willing creatures your size or smaller equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of two). • Your casting time for teleportation circle is 1 round instead of 1 minute. In addition, you can create a permanent teleportation circle by casting the spell in the same location every day for one month instead of one year. • Whenever you take damage while you are concentrating on the banishment or levitation spells, you make your Consitution saving throw to maintain your concentration with advantage.
Source: DMDave, EVIL p.11
